job_description:
Apprenticeship Opportunity at Electronics Technology Parks Kerala (Technopark)

About Technopark: Electronics Technology Parks Kerala (Technopark) is seeking talented and driven graduates for paid apprenticeships at Park Centre, Technopark Campus, Trivandrum.

Opportunity: Grab this opportunity to gain hands-on experience in Electronics and Communication.

Contract Duration: 1 year

Contact Information: * Email: apprenticeship@technopark.in * Website: https://technopark.in

Closing Date: 08, Sept 2025 Job Published: 02, Sept 2025

Requirements

  • Diploma in Electronics and Communication, Electrical and Electronics, Electronics & Instrumentation, and Applied Electronics (pass out from 2021 onwards).
  • Ability to communicate clearly and consistently, and a natural interest in working with people.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Monitor and operate the CCTV surveillance system from the Control Room on a continuous basis.
  • Perform live monitoring of all access points, perimeters, and critical areas within the Technopark campus to ensure security and safety.
  • Log and report any suspicious activity, unauthorized access, or system anomalies to the concerned authority immediately.
  • Register and respond to grievances and complaints received in the Control Room; coordinate follow-up actions as necessary.
  • Maintain clear and accurate records of incidents, system faults, or maintenance needs in the Control Room logbook.
  • Assist AMC technicians or authorized service personnel with on-ground support, system checks, or troubleshooting as required.
  • Ensure proper functioning of all surveillance equipment and report any technical issues or malfunctions without delay.
  • Adhere to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and always maintain confidentiality and data security.
  • Maintain cleanliness and operational readiness of the Control Room environment.

Preferred Skills

  • Shift Timings: Operators will work in rotating 8-hour shifts.
    • Morning Shift: 6:00 AM to 2:00 PM
    • Afternoon Shift: 2:00 PM to 10:00 PM
    • Night Shift: 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM

Stipend

  • Rs.12,000/month.

How to Apply

Interested candidates may send their resumes to apprenticeship@technopark.in with “Application for Technician Apprentice – Control Room” as the subject. Please attach scanned copies of your certificates along with your resume. The last date to apply is 08.09.2025.

Note: The vacancies notified here are subject to change without assigning any reason, and Technopark reserves the right to change, modify, add, or cancel the recruitment process if required.
summary: Technopark is offering paid apprenticeships for talented graduates. This role involves monitoring CCTV systems and ensuring security within the Technopark campus.

company: Macrosoft It Solutions India Pvt. Ltd
job_description:
Business Analyst - COBOL Modernization

Macrosoft IT Solutions India Pvt Ltd. is seeking an expert Business Analyst to play a pivotal role in Migrating Legacy CCM.

Office Location: Technopark, Trivandrum (Option to Work From Home)

Contact Email: jobs@macrosoftindia.com

Closing Date: 01, Oct 2025

Job Description: The ideal candidate should have a strong foundation in business analysis—specifically in creating detailed requirement documents from the ground up—and possesses the rare technical skill of understanding and documenting complex COBOL programs. Your primary mission will be to analyze legacy programs and produce a clear, comprehensive "blueprint" (BRDs and Functional Specifications) that will guide the successful migration and inform development in new technologies.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Translate Code into Business Requirements: You will perform functional decomposition of COBOL programs, JCL, and Unix scripts. Your goal is to go beyond just reading the code; you will trace data flows and process logic to meticulously document the "what" and "why". Your deep understanding of the documented COBOL programs will be the foundation for all future development.
  • Author the Blueprint for Modernization: You will be the primary author of our migration roadmap. This involves creating exceptionally detailed Business Requirement Documents (BRDs) and Functional Specification Documents (FSDs). These documents will include process flows, explicit business rules, data mappings, and use cases. They must be so thorough that a developer with zero knowledge of the legacy system can use them to accurately build its modern equivalent.

Preferred Skills/Qualifications:

  • Proven Business Analyst Experience: Minimum 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a proven track record of creating comprehensive BRDs and Functional Specifications.
  • COBOL Documentation Expertise: Must have significant, hands-on experience (at least 2+ years) where a primary responsibility was analyzing, understanding, and formally documenting the business logic contained within COBOL programs, JCL, and related mainframe assets.
  • Demonstrated Documentation Mastery: A portfolio or ability to discuss in detail past projects where you created BRDs/FSDs from scratch by reverse-engineering legacy code.
  • Technical Acumen: Strong ability to read and interpret COBOL and JCL. Solid understanding of UNIX environment.
  • Exceptional Communication Skills: A unique ability to translate complex technical details from source code into clear, unambiguous business and functional requirements for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Education: A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
summary: Seeking a Business Analyst with 5+ years of experience for COBOL modernization, creating BRDs and FSDs. The role involves translating code into business requirements.

job_description:
Full Stack Developer

Good Methods Software Solutions (P) Ltd is seeking a talented Full Stack Developer to join our team focused on revolutionizing Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) with AI, automation, and data-driven workflows. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a startup-mode team, operating as a tech-agnostic innovation unit.

Contact: visakhgoommen@carestack.com

Closing Date: 30, Sept 2025

About CareStack: CareStack builds cloud platforms that modernize U.S. dental practices. This team will operate as a tech-agnostic innovation unit focused on transforming manual RCM processes into scalable, tech-enabled solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Take untapped RCM opportunities, design full-stack solutions that solve real problems, ship them to production, and iterate on real-world feedback.
  • Select and justify the best tools / frameworks per project; implement PoCs when needed.
  • Build and maintain secure, scalable APIs, UIs, automations, and data pipelines.
  • Integrate third-party systems (EHR, CRM, payment gateways, RPA bots).
  • Uphold code quality with reviews, automated tests, CI/CD, and cloud-native best practices.
  • Mentor junior engineers in problem-solving and tech-agnostic thinking.
  • Work closely with the RCM operations team to understand pain points and identify high-impact automation opportunities.
  • Focus on measurable business outcomes rather than processes, with emphasis on RCM performance metrics improvement.

Why Join Us?

  • Own green-field products that directly cut costs and boost revenue.
  • Work in a lean, cross-functional squad with minimal bureaucracy or office politics—focus purely on shipping the best solution with the right tech.
  • Have your voice matter. Your ideas and feedback directly influence product direction, while you gain ample room for professional growth.
  • Be part of transforming RCM operations into a tech-enabled, highly scalable offering that sets the gold standard in the industry.

Experience: 2-8 Years

Location: Trivandrum, Kochi (Onsite)

Notice period: Immediate 30 days

Must-Have Skills & Mindset:

  • 2 – 8 years designing, coding, testing, and running production software end‑to‑end.
  • Proven ability to learn new stacks fast and pick “best‑fit” tech (language, framework, cloud, DB) per use case.
  • Deep grasp of computer‑science fundamentals, distributed systems, and REST/gRPC/GraphQL API design.
  • Solid understanding of front‑end ↔ back‑end integration patterns (contract design, API gateways, auth flows) and real‑time communication (WebSockets, SSE, pub‑sub, event streams).
  • Hands‑on cloud (AWS / GCP / Azure) with container orchestration and observability.
  • Strong unit / integration testing discipline; Git & trunk‑based workflows.
  • Bias for metrics‑driven decisions and rapid experimentation.
  • Outcome-focused approach that prioritizes solving real business problems over following rigid processes.
  • Excellent written & verbal communication with non‑technical stakeholders.
summary: Seeking a Full Stack Developer to innovate Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) using AI and automation. Responsibilities include designing solutions, building APIs, and integrating third-party systems to improve RCM performance.

job_description:
Senior Front-End Engineer (React.js, Next.js) | REMOTE

Reizend (P) Ltd SBC Module 15, -2 Floor, Thejaswini Building, Technopark phase 1, Trivandrum, 695581 http://www.reizendretail.in

Closing Date: 15, Oct 2025 Job Published: 31, Aug 2025 Contact Email: careers@reizend.ai

Brief Description: Working Timing: (6:30 pm - 2:30 am) Work mode: Remote Experience Required: 12+ yrs Salary Package: 15-30 LPA Specialization: Scalable UI Architecture, Performance Engineering, Cross-Platform Front-End Development.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Front-End Engineer with expertise in React.js, Next.js, and modern front-end ecosystems to design and implement scalable, secure, and high-performing UI architectures for our digital products. The ideal candidate is passionate about performance engineering, accessibility, and maintainable code and is capable of guiding architecture decisions and mentoring cross-functional teams.

You will work closely with designers, backend engineers, and product managers to create seamless and intuitive user experiences across platforms and browsers, contributing to both technical excellence and business impact.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Architect and build modular, high-performance UIs using React.js (Hooks, Context API, Suspense) and Next.js (App Router, SSR, SSG).
  • Lead front-end application architecture with micro-frontend patterns, Web Components, and Module Federation.
  • Implement scalable state management using tools like Redux Toolkit, Zustand, or Recoil.
  • Integrate RESTful and GraphQL APIs using Axios, Fetch, Apollo Client, or URQL.
  • Ensure optimal build and bundling using tools like Webpack, Vite, or Rollup.
  • Optimize application performance using code splitting, lazy loading, tree shaking, WebP, asset optimization, and HTTP/2.
  • Maintain security best practices: mitigate OWASP Top 10 issues (XSS, CSRF), enforce CSP, use secure cookies, validate input, and implement secure authentication flows (OAuth2, JWT, Firebase Auth).
  • Deliver pixel-perfect, accessible, and responsive UI using WCAG 2.1 guidelines, semantic HTML, ARIA, Tailwind UI, Material UI, or ShadCn.
  • Conduct performance audits using Lighthouse, React Profiler, and browser DevTools.
  • Own the visual and functional QA process: build tests using Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, Playwright, and Storybook + Chromatic for visual regression.
  • Collaborate with DevOps to maintain CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or CircleCI.
  • Participate in and lead design reviews, documentation efforts, and sprint planning in Agile teams.
  • Utilize AI-powered development tools like GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Cline, or custom LLM-based agents to improve development velocity and test quality.

Preferred Skills

Bachelors/Masters in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent.

  • 12+ years of hands-on experience in front-end development, building production-grade React applications with Next.js.
  • Proficient in JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript, HTML5, CSS3/SCSS.
  • Strong architectural understanding of component design, modularization, micro frontends, and code reuse strategies.
  • Experience with state management tools like Redux Toolkit, Zustand, or Recoil.
  • In-depth understanding of accessibility, cross-browser compatibility, and responsive design.
  • Proficient in Git workflows, npm/yarn/pnpm, and modern IDEs like VSCode.
  • Solid testing practices using unit, integration, and visual regression testing tools.
  • Experience working in monorepos, Module Federation, or multi-team frontend architectures.
  • Familiarity with server-side rendering, static site generation, and edge rendering with Next.js.
  • Experience with containerized environments (Docker) for front-end dev environments.
  • Exposure to RAG, Langchain, or other LLM-based integrations in front-end workflows.
  • Skilled in cross-functional collaboration tools: Figma, Zeplin, Adobe XD, Jira, Confluence.
  • Strong advocacy for performance, UX, accessibility, and clean code practices.

Professional Attributes:

  • A passion for clean code and scalable architecture.
  • Strong communication and mentorship skills, with experience onboarding and upskilling developers.
  • Ability to lead through influence and evangelize best practices in front-end engineering.
  • Proactive in problem-solving, with a mindset of ownership and continuous improvement.
summary: Reizend is seeking a Senior Front-End Engineer to design and implement scalable UI architectures using React.js and Next.js. The role involves leading architecture decisions, mentoring teams, and ensuring high-performance, accessible user experiences.
